name: NTUC
description: Pioneering workers' rights since 1961, the National Trades Union Congress (NTUC) unites 58 trade unions, seven trade associations, seven social enterprises, and other enterprise partners as we create better lives for workers here in Singapore. Our work cuts across the different ages and stages of life as we walk the ground and respond to everyday needs. We support workers by protecting them, transforming careers, managing costs, and nurturing relationships to improve wages, welfare, and work prospects.
features: Build a strong, responsible, and caring Labour Movement.
Enhance the social status and well-being of our members and workers.
Help Singapore stay competitive, and workers remain employable.
business_objectives: Build a More Diverse and Inclusive Workforce

enhanced_description: The National Trades Union Congress (NTUC), established in 1961, is a national confederation of 58 trade unions, seven trade associations, seven social enterprises, and other enterprise partners in Singapore. Serving workers across industrial, service, and public sectors, NTUC is dedicated to creating better lives for workers by protecting their rights, transforming careers through upskilling and development, managing costs, and nurturing relationships to improve wages, welfare, and overall work prospects. A core objective is to build a more diverse and inclusive workforce and to enhance the social status and well-being of its members, ultimately helping Singapore remain competitive and its workers employable.

Supporting the competitiveness of Singapore's workforce.
